What is the super Constructor?
questionBank.a: allows you invoke a constructor of the base class within the definition of a derived class constructor
questionBank.b: A more safer way to invoke a constructor
questionBank.c: Allows you to inherit from multiple constructors

questionBank.question: Which one of these statements is NOT about inheritance?
questionBank.a: it is one of the main techniques of OOP
questionBank.b: means that a very general form of a class can be defined and compiled
questionBank.c: process by which a new class—known as a derived class—is created from another class, called the base class.

What does overriding mean?
questionBank.a: The base class method being redefined in the derived class
questionBank.b: The derived class method being redefined in the base class
questionBank.c: It makes sure the derived class method cannot redefine its method
questionBank.d: It makes sure the base class method cannot redefine its method
